page.title: 09Housing Around Inverbervie
page.content: Being a rural area there are no tenements or multi-storeys to be seen. The houses are mostly{council or} {private houses.} Since oil was discovered in the North Sea many houses have been built in the last ten years. Most of the private housing has appeared on land to the east of the A92 road, while two different lots of council houses were built to the west. Many of the new private houses have been bought by those working in the oil industry - often those who work two weeks offshore, two weeks onshore and to whom travelling is not a major concern. The only other concentration of houses is part of a council house scheme in Gourdon. With farms needing fewer workers several farm cottages are empty.
